question: What type of expenditure is associated with owning hardware and IT infrastructure?
options: A. One-time
B. Monthly
C. Quarterly
D. Capital
E. Recurring
answer: D

question: What is an Amazon Machine Image (AMI)?
options: A. A template that contains a software configuration (operating system, application server, and applications) that you can run on Amazon EC2.
B. A virtual machine over which developers have complete control.
C. An Elastic IP Address that provides a static endpoint to an Amazon EC2 instance.
D. An Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume that persists independently from the life of an instance.
E. An Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) object that is redundantly stored on multiple devices across multiple facilities in an Amazon S3 Region.
answer: A. A template that contains a software configuration (operating system, application server, and applications) that you can run on Amazon EC2.

question: What is the maximum storage capacity of an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume?
options: A. 1 MB
B. 5 MB
C. 10 MB
D. 100 MB
E. 1 TB
answer: E. 1 TB

question: What is the challenge of running tests on AWS?
options: A. Provisioning infrastructure resources
B. Automating the process of running tests
C. Ensuring enough resources are available
D. Initializing test environments with the right software
E. All of the above
answer: E. All of the above

question: What is the benefit of using AWS CloudFormation?
options: A. Creating and deleting a collection of resources together as a single unit
B. Using templates to create and delete a collection of resources
C. Describing a complete test environment running on AWS in a template
D. Editing and managing templates in the same source code repository
E. All of the above
answer: E. All of the above

question: What is the equivalent of hibernating the operating system when shutting down a development environment?
options: A. Stop the instances
B. Terminate them
C. DeleteOnTermination flag
D. Commit all work
E. Recreate from an AMI
answer: A. Stop the instances

question: What happens to the data stored on ephemeral drives when a stop/start sequence is performed?
options: A. Data is stored
B. Data is backed up
C. Data is lost
D. Data is deleted
E. Data is committed
answer: C. Data is lost

question: What is the DeleteOnTermination flag?
options: A. Used to commit all work
B. Used to save resources and cost
C. Used to delete the root device
D. Used to store data
E. Used to prevent data loss
answer: C. Used to delete the root device

question: What does Amazon VPC allow?
options: A. To store source code
B. To bundle AMI(s)
C. To extend the on-premise private network to the cloud
D. To install and maintain specialized sets of tools
E. To switch context
answer: C. To extend the on-premise private network to the cloud

question: What is the purpose of creating separate accounts for development and test activities?
options: A. To help customers understand the development and test cycle
B. To separate teams and responsibilities
C. To enable collaboration
D. To simplify payments
E. To organize and track AWS costs
answer: B. To separate teams and responsibilities

question: What does AWS offer to enable sharing of resources across accounts?
options: A. Amazon S3 objects
B. AMIs
C. Amazon EBS Snapshots
D. Cost Allocation Report
E. Resource tagging
answer: A. Amazon S3 objects, B. AMIs, C. Amazon EBS Snapshots

question: What is the purpose of resource tagging?
options: A. To help customers understand the development and test cycle
B. To separate teams and responsibilities
C. To enable collaboration
D. To simplify payments
E. To organize and track AWS costs
answer: E. To organize and track AWS costs

question: What does the AWS Global Cloud Infrastructure consist of?
options: A. Availability Zones, Regions, and Edge Networks
B. Servers, Networking Devices, and Storage Appliances
C. Data Centers, Servers, and Networking Devices
D. Availability Zones, Data Centers, and Edge Networks
E. Regions, Servers, and Storage Appliances
answer: A. Availability Zones, Regions, and Edge Networks

question: What is the AWS Global Cloud Infrastructure used for?
options: A. To provide a secure and reliable cloud platform
B. To run applications in two or more data centers
C. To deliver cached content to global end-users
D. To open up new regions faster than other cloud providers
E. To serve over a million active customers in 190 countries
answer: A. To provide a secure and reliable cloud platform

question: How many data centers does AWS own and operate?
options: A. Hundreds
B. Thousands
C. Tens of thousands
D. Hundreds of thousands
E. Millions
answer: B. Thousands

question: What is the primary purpose of using data centers?
options: A. To house computer systems, network devices, and storage appliances
B. To open up new regions faster than other cloud providers
C. To deliver cached content to global end-users
D. To provide a secure and reliable cloud platform
E. To serve over a million active customers in 190 countries
answer: A. To house computer systems, network devices, and storage appliances

question: What is an Availability Zone?
options: A. A cluster of interconnected data centers in a specific geographic zone
B. A single AWS Region
C. A single datacenter
D. A specific country
E. A data privacy compliance
answer: A. A cluster of interconnected data centers in a specific geographic zone

question: What is the purpose of running an application or a database in two or more Availability Zones?
options: A. To improve the durability of data
B. To replicate data to two or more regions
C. To comply with data sovereignty requirement
D. To build a highly available, fault-tolerant, and scalable cloud architecture
E. To store sensitive data in a certain location or country
answer: D. To build a highly available, fault-tolerant, and scalable cloud architecture

question: What is the typical distance between the data centers of a single Availability Zone?
options: A. 100 kilometers
B. 60 miles
C. Hundreds of kilometers
D. Hundreds of miles
E. Within a specific country
answer: B. 60 miles

question: What is the purpose of replicating data to two or more regions?
options: A. To improve the durability of data
B. To comply with data sovereignty requirement
C. To build a highly available, fault-tolerant, and scalable cloud architecture
D. To store sensitive data in a certain location or country
E. To replicate data to two or more availability zones
answer: A. To improve the durability of data

question: What is the purpose of data sovereignty requirement?
options: A. To improve the durability of data
B. To replicate data to two or more regions
C. To comply with data sovereignty requirement
D. To build a highly available, fault-tolerant, and scalable cloud architecture
E. To store sensitive data in a certain location or country
answer: E. To store sensitive data in a certain location or country

question: Q3. What is an AWS Local Region?
options: A. A region code followed by a letter identifier
B. A single datacenter designed to complement an existing AWS Region
C. A point of presence used by CloudFront and Lambda@edge services
D. A location that CloudFront uses to cache copies of content
E. A low-latency connection between two networks
answer: B. A single datacenter designed to complement an existing AWS Region

question: Q4. What is the purpose of an Edge Location?
options: A. To provide a secure cloud platform for businesses
B. To provide a global edge network of Points-of-Presence
C. To provide a content delivery network
D. To provide a low-latency connection between two networks
E. To provide a location that CloudFront uses to cache copies of content
answer: E. To provide a location that CloudFront uses to cache copies of content

question: What are the three fundamental drivers of cost with AWS?
options: A. Compute, Storage, and Inbound data transfer
B. Compute, Storage, and Outbound data transfer
C. Compute, Storage, and Networking
D. Compute, Storage, and Database
E. Compute, Storage, and Security
answer: B. Compute, Storage, and Outbound data transfer

question: What is the maximum discount you can get with Reserved Instances?
What is the All Upfront option for Reserved Instances?
options: A. A low upfront payment and a discounted hourly rate for the duration of the Reserved Instance term
B. A large upfront payment and a discounted hourly rate for the duration of the Reserved Instance term
C. A low upfront payment and no discounted hourly rate for the duration of the Reserved Instance term
D. A large upfront payment and no discounted hourly rate for the duration of the Reserved Instance term
E. No upfront payment and no discounted hourly rate for the duration of the Reserved Instance term
answer: B. A large upfront payment and a discounted hourly rate for the duration of the Reserved Instance term

question: What is AWS Free Tier?
options: A. A discounted hourly rate for the duration of the Reserved Instance term
B. A free trial of AWS products for 12 months
C. A free trial of AWS products for 6 months
D. A free trial of AWS products for 24 months
E. A free trial of AWS products for 36 months
answer: B. A free trial of AWS products for 12 months
